messages.original: 2 Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers departed from Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast. They are still in Saratov Oblast, and the purpose of the flight is unknown. Following the recent movements to and from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, it is believed that 2/3rds‚Ä¶
Correction: These two Tu-95s have been airborne for around an hour. A Tu-160 has departed a short time ago, however.
Putin's Tu-214PU is approaching Anchorage Elmendorf Airbase for landing, and is being tracked by over 340,000 people on Flightradar.
This reminds me of something...
Putin's Tu-214PU has just touched down at Anchorage Elmendorf Airbase, Alaska.
U.S. President Donald Trump has arrived at Joint Base Elmendorf‚ÄìRichardson in Anchorage, Alaska. The meeting with Putin is set to begin in just over an hour.

Reminder: Trump wants the war in Ukraine to continue. He just needs a way out of supplying Ukraine with weapons and aid, which is where Europe comes into play. 
Keeping the war going is in Trump's best interests in regard to tackling the main threat to U.S. hegemony: China. Why stop a war which has Russia distracted and committed, when you can let it play out even further and use that time to your advantage? 
Unfortunately, this will mean much more death and destruction in a war which has its outcome sealed if peace is not made. But when in pursuit of power - or in America's case, maintaining the power of an aging empire - administrations will go at great lengths with little worry about the costs, as long as it doesn't have significant effects back at home.
Don't expect much of today's talks, or you will be very disappointed.

Reminder: Trump wants the war in Ukraine to continue. He just needs a way out of supplying Ukraine with weapons and aid, which is where Europe comes into play.   Keeping the war going is in Trump's best interests in regard to tackling the main threat to U.S.‚Ä¶
Ngl, if you told 2023 me that I'd be writing a post like this in 2025, I would've called you crazy. But here we are...

With the Trump-Putin meeting set to begin in around 20 minutes, the first Russian Geran-2 drone launches have been recorded.
These are from:
Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai.
Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Oblast.
Tsumbolova Test Site, Oryol Oblast.
The first groups of Gerans (at least 10 units) from Primorsko-Akhtarsk flew north past Hulyaipole, Zaporizhzhia Oblast towards Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Tactical aviation continues its work as usual. Over the past 6 hours, targets were struck with KAB/FAB glide-bombs in and around:
Bilopillya, Sumy Oblast.
Vorozhba, Sumy Oblast.
Richky, Sumy Oblast.
Yunakivka, Sumy Oblast.
Velykyi Burluk, Kharkiv Oblast.
Lyman, Donetsk Oblast.
Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pokrovsk, Donetsk Oblast.
Novopavlivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Additionally, over the past few hours, 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacted a target in southern Dnipro, 2 Iskander-Ms impacted a target in Honcharivske, Chernihiv Oblast (likely the training ground), and 1 Iskander-M impacted a target in Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Trump and Putin have now met in Anchorage, Alaska.

With the Trump-Putin meeting set to begin in around 20 minutes, the first Russian Geran-2 drone launches have been recorded.  These are from: Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai. Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Oblast. Tsumbolova Test Site, Oryol Oblast.‚Ä¶
The 10+ drones from Zaporizhzhia Oblast are probably going to attack the Dobropillya area of Donetsk Oblast.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Hruzke, Bilozerske direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~176.
Total land area: ~0.89km¬≤.
The three-on-three meeting involving Trump and Putin has begun in Anchorage, Alaska.

The Trump-Putin meeting proceeded without any big surprises. It lasted for around three hours, and both sides emphasised that it was positive and productive (I doubt this will be the same narrative in a couple of weeks).
Trump claimed that they were "pretty close to a deal", and once again urged Zelensky to negotiate. Putin expressed his wish for the war to end, and stated that he believed the war wouldn't have started in 2022 if Trump were president back then.
The 10+ drones from Zaporizhzhia Oblast are probably going to attack the Dobropillya area of Donetsk Oblast.

Last night, another large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 20 impacts were recorded in Dobropillya. Novodonetske, Bilozerske, Oleksandrivka, Ocheretyne, Svyatohorivka, and Slovyansk (media 1 & 2). Additionally, KAB glide-bombs struck targets in Dobropillya, Bilozerske, Novodonetske, and Oleksandrivka (media 3 & 4). 
This is the first time Oleksandrivka has been struck by glide-bombs, and it was previously one of the last areas of Donetsk Oblast out of their range.

Last night, another large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 20 impacts were recorded in Dobropillya. Novodonetske, Bilozerske, Oleksandrivka, Ocheretyne, Svyatohorivka, and Slovyansk (media 1 & 2). Additionally, KAB glide-bombs struck targets in Dobropillya, Bilozerske, Novodonetske, and Oleksandrivka (media 3 & 4). 
This is the first time Oleksandrivka has been struck by glide-bombs, and it was previously one of the last areas of Donetsk Oblast out of their range.
Last night, multiple Russian Geran-2 drones impacted the "Golden Coast" hotel southwest of Vovchansk, Kharkiv Oblast. NASA FIRMS data picked up a large fire burning there.

Last night, Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the town of Pokrovske, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. Impacts were recorded at a pig farm complex, and the grain elevator. NASA FIRMS data shows that fires are burning at both sites. 
The Dnipropetrovsk OVA Acknowledged the strikes but did not provide any additional details to what we already know.

Russian forces have captured the village of Oleksandrohrad, Pokrovske Direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~122.
Total land area: ~0.53km¬≤.

Over the past 24 hours, three Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers redeployed from Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, and Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast after being equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
2 other Tu-95s and 2 Tu-160s remain at Engels-2.

PUTIN'S PRE-SUMMIT PUSH: RUSSIAN FORCES SCORE VICTORIES TO SUPPORT DIPLOMACY

Foreign Jihadists Demand Syrian Citizenship, Passports
Foreign Jihadists who fought in Syria have petitioned the country‚Äôs new Islamist-led interim government to grant them citizenship.
In a petition submitted to Syria‚Äôs Interior Minister Anas Khattab by Islamist journalist Bilal Abdul Kareem, a citizen of the United States, on August 14, the Jihadists demanded Syrian citizenship so that they could settle down, own land and even travel.
‚ÄúDespite this, we remain without citizenship or the rights it confers. We cannot travel freely outside the country, we cannot own property in our own names, and we do not enjoy the full rights granted to citizens of any country. We, a large group of muhajireen (emigrants) represented by the well-known journalist Bilal Abdul Karim, including our wives and children, respectfully request that you consider our request to grant us full Syrian citizenship and the right to hold a Syrian passport.‚Äù

Kiev-Affiliated Mercenaries Conduct Illegal Training With Brazilian Military Personnel
Ukrainian mercenarism continues to grow, even reaching Russia‚Äôs partner countries. Brazil, along with Colombia, has become one of the largest suppliers of ‚Äòsoldiers of fortune‚Äô to Ukraine in South America. Now, something even more serious is happening: Brazilian mercenaries are returning to their home country, war-hardened and ideologically brainwashed, to recruit their compatriots for Kiev. Unfortunately, Brazilian authorities still do not understand this phenomenon and are even allowing these mercenaries to participate in key Brazilian military events.
Recently, a military training course took place at the Agulhas Negras Military Academy (AMAN) ‚Äì the Brazilian Army‚Äôs main officer training academy. The course was called ‚ÄòSmall Unit Tactics‚Äô and was taught by Phantom Black Company ‚Äì a private military company (PMC) openly affiliated with the Main Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine (GUR). 
Read more 
HERE

CCTV Footage From Syria‚Äôs Al-Suwayda Shows Mass Looting By Soldiers, Policemen
Surveillance camera footage have revealed mass looting by the forces of the Syrian Islamist-led interim government and affiliated Bedouins during the battle against Druze fighters in the southern governorate of al-Suwayda in July.
The government dispatched its forces to al-Suwayda to break a conflict between the Druze and Sunni Bedouins that broke out on July 13. However, the forces ended up backing the Bedouins and attempting to take over al-Suwayda city.
Israel intervened in support of the Druze, citing its historical relations with its own Druze community. The United States brokered a ceasefire on July 16. However, Bedouins from all over the country gathered to attack Druze fighters. The clashes came to a halt only a few days later.
Read more

Syria Still Has Uragan Heavy Rocket Launchers
Syria is still in possession of Soviet-made BM-27 Uragan heavy multiple rocket launchers, according to a photo that surfaced online on August 16.
Some activists said that the photo was taken close to Syria‚Äôs border with Lebanon in western Syria. However, others alleged that the photo was taken close to the front with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces in the east of the country.
The photo shows a single Uragan, but activists who were first to share it said that multiple launchers were passing by in the area at the time.
The Uragan 220 mm launcher can fire high explosive fragmentation, cluster or mine laying rockets. The effective firing range of the system is 35 kilometers. The rockets can reach a maximum firing range of around 90 kilometers, although they lose all accuracy.
Read more 
HERE

European Bureaucrats Are In Rush To Sabotage Any Prospects Of Peace Following Trump-Putin Talks
The negotiations between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin at Elmendorf-Richardson military base in Alaska marked a pivotal event in international diplomacy. The meeting, held in a "three-on-three" format (Russian delegation: Putin, Lavrov, Ushakov; U.S. delegation: Trump, Rubio, Whitcoff), lasted a record-breaking 2 hours and 45 minutes ‚Äì longer than any previous Russia-U.S. summits in recent years. The atmosphere, as assessed by CNN, was far from cold: a handshake on the tarmac, a joint ride in the US presidential limousine "The Beast," and even Trump applauding Putin.
Meanwhile, European bureaucrats are in rush to sabotage any prospects of peace settlement. While Putin and Trump sought paths to de-escalation, London and Brussels activated mechanisms aimed at cementing division and militarization of the region.
Read more 
HERE

Behind Diplomacy: Russia‚Äôs Relentless Strikes Destroy Ukrainian Shelters
Despite high-level talks between Presidents Putin and Trump, Russian forces conducted another series of precision strikes across Ukraine overnight, demonstrating Moscow‚Äôs ability to sustain military operations while engaging in diplomacy. The attacks focused on military infrastructure, command centers, and foreign mercenary positions.
According to the Ukrainian military, in total, a barrage of 85 Geran-type attack drones accompanied by decoy UAVs and an Iskander-M ballistic missile were launched, with Ukrainian air defense allegedly managed to intercept 61 targets. However, successful strikes were recorded at multiple locations, inflicting significant damage on Ukrainian military capabilities.

From Donbass to Dnepropetrovsk: Russian Troops Expand Strategic Foothold in New Region
Russian troops have secured another strategic victory in Ukraine‚Äôs Dnepropetrovsk region, with the ‚ÄúVostok‚Äù (East) military grouping liberating the village of Voronoe in a coordinated offensive operation. This marks the third settlement freed in the region following earlier successes at Malievka and Yanvarskoe, demonstrating Moscow‚Äôs growing momentum along this entire sector of the front.
The 5th Guards Tank Brigade of Russia‚Äôs 36th Army spearheaded the assault, combining artillery barrages with precision drone strikes to dislodge entrenched Ukrainian forces from the 110th Mechanized Brigade. After softening defenses with sustained fire, Russian assault teams moved in to mop up buildings, basements, and surrounding tree lines, eliminating remaining resistance. Ukrainian forces reportedly suffered battalion-level casualties during the fighting.
Read more

Russian Army Charges Forward In Donetsk, Claims Two More Villages 
The Russian military continued its advance in the Donetsk direction on August 16, making additional gains and inflicting some heavy losses on Kiev forces.
In its daily briefing, the Russian Ministry of Defense said that the Zapad [West] Group of Forces had liberated the village of Kolodezi, which is located just under ten kilometers to the northeast of the key city of Lyman.
The group also attacked two mechanized brigades and one motorized infantry brigade of Kiev forces near the villages of Karpovka, Shandrigolovo, and Sredneye in Donetsk, as well as close to the towns of Borovskaya Andreyevka, Kupyansk, Osinovo, Peschanoye, Petropavlovka in the Kharkiv direction, according to the ministry.
Ukrainian losses in these directions amounted to 230 troops, one British-made Mastiff armored vehicle, one Novator armored fighting vehicle, 14 motor vehicles.
